title: Anxiety: From Surviving to Thriving
author: Faith Dolan, Peer Educator
introduction: Experiencing occasional nervousness, worry, or overwhelm is a natural part of being human. Nervousness in response to manageable stressors is 'eustress' â€“ a constructive form of stress. However, excessive stress can jeopardize overall well-being.

sections.title: Anxiety's Signs and Symptoms
mental_symptoms: Heightened state of agitation or panic
Sense of detachment or disconnect from surroundings
physical_symptoms: Increased urgency to use the restroom
Overall sense of unwellness or feeling sick

sections.title: Reframing and Reconsidering
sections.content: Strategies to manage anxiety include reframing 'what-if' thoughts, replacing polarized thinking, and practicing self-compassion and mindfulness.

sections.title: Finding Your Roots
sections.app_suggestion: Texas Tech Students have free access to Shmoody, a mental health app for mindfulness.

sections.title: Coping Mechanisms
methods: Social activities such as meeting friends or calling a loved one
Creative activities like writing, doodling, or listening to music
Physical activities such as exercising or crying
Relaxing activities like taking a bath, watching a show, or meditating

sections.title: Changing the Factors that Can Contribute to Anxiety
sections.content: Evaluating sleep habits and substance use can provide insight into anxiety levels. Sleep is essential for mental well-being.
